abstract.para: Extended CSV ECSV is a simple self describing file format for archive and exchange tabular data based on the Comma Separated CSV file format.

section.title: Terminology
section.para: The key words must , must not , required , shall , shall not , should , should not , recommended , may , and optional in this OASIS Standard are to be interpreted as described in . Note that for reasons of style, these words are not capitalized in this document.

section.title: Character Set
section.para: ECSV files are designed to support data in any language, not just US ASCII. To facilitate this the ECSV supports the full Universal Character Set (UCS), defined in [ISO10646] . The characters defined by [ISO10646] are the same as those defined in the [UNICODE] character set.

section.title: Character Encoding
section.para: ECSV files must be encoded using UTF-8 encoding as defined in [ISO1646-1:2000]/[RFC3629].
UTF-8 is a variable byte encoding of UCS, where 7-bit US-ASCII is encoded as a single byte, other characters are encoded using 2-6 bytes, although the most common characters use a maximum of 3 bytes.

section.title: Section Separator
section.para: ECSV files contain multiple sections, each section is separated by an empty line ending with the line feed '\n' (0x0A) character.

section.title: Record Separator
section.para: ECSV files contain records, each record must be separated by the line feed '\n' (0x0A) character.

section.title: Field Separator
section.para: ECSV records contain 1 or more fields, each field must be separated by the the comma ',' (0x2C) character.

section.title: Field Values
section.para: ECSV field values may contain any UCS character, including whitespace and field/record separator characters.

Fields containing the record separator, field separator or double quote characters must be enclosed within a pair of double quote '"' (0x22) characters (e.g. "Main St, Vancouver"). In addition field values which contain the double quote character must be encoded as a pair of double quote characters (e.g. 'this has "quoted" text' would become 'this has ""quoted"" text').

section.title: Binary Data
section.para: ECSV fields values containing binary data must be encoded using either Base64 [RFC2045] or hexBinary encodings.

The hexBinary encoding is where each byte is encoded as a pair of Hexidecimal digits [0-9a-fA-F] representing the byte value (e.g. "B5" is the encoding for the byte 10110101). Multiple bytes can be represented as multiple pairs of Hexidecimal digits.

section.title: ECSV Sections
section.para: ECSV files contain the three sections described below.

section.title: File Header
section.para: The file header contains the metadata related to the whole file

section.title: Data Header
section.para: This section contains the metadata about each field in a data record. Each record in the data header must have the same number of entries. The data header section contains the 2 records described below. Any additional records in this section must be ignored when reading the file. Additional data header records may be added in future versions of the speicifcation.

listitem.para: This record contains the names of each of the fields. . Unlike other field formats any UCS character can be used as part of the name of a field.
